feed.title: Jake Zimmerman | Osx
feed.subtitle: A collection of blog posts about programming, software, types, programming languages, Sorbet, Vim, Markdown, and more.

entry.title: Troubleshooting Haskell Stack Setup on OS X

link.title: Troubleshooting Haskell Stack Setup on OS X

entry.summary: Stephen Diehl's article "Vim and Haskell in 2016" does a great job of outlining the quickest way to get a quality Haskell development experience. His post presumes Ubuntu; here we presume OS X.

entry.title: SML Dev Setup
entry.summary: Let's walk through a couple easy steps you can take to make developing SML feel more fluid, both in and out of your editor.

entry.title: Offline LaTeX Development - Part 2
entry.summary: LaTeX development with Vim and the command line, now featuring split-pane windows!
